channel.title: A *Simple* Content Management System?
channel.description:
I need a really simple content management system which doesn't have polls, registering, categories, advertisement plans and that. Nothing like Joomla or PHP Nuke where you have to spend hours setting it up.
I just want something simple, that looks good, where I can just post articles. Nothing fancy.
Anyone know of one that is free?

item.title: A *Simple* Content Management System?

item.description:
@Falko222 wrote:

Mr.Chris i recommend either Geeklog or phpWCMS

item.description:
@Mr.Chris wrote:

Silver Lining:

You sound like a Moparscape user when you say that. “I WUNT IT EZ 2 USE ADN 2 LUK PRFCT”

Your pathetic. You get at me because…?

And yes, there are things that are easy to use, and I never said I wanted it to look perfect. I wanted it to look good.

Stop trying to dig at me because you have some personal issues.

item.title: A *Simple* Content Management System?
item.dc:creator: @Mr.Chris Mr.Chris
item.description:
@Mr.Chris wrote:

Thanks Bob. Also, I just noticed that Fantastico has XOOPS, so I’ll have a look at that.

Thank you <3[br][size=1]Posted on: 25-01-2007, 13:09:47[/size][hr]Update - XOOPS isn’t right for me. I’m looking for something much more easier to use that looks really nice.

Read full topic

item.title: A *Simple* Content Management System?
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

Just about every CMS known to man: http://www.cmsmatrix.org

I haven’t played around with that many, but Drupal looked pretty good. Also, check out XOOPS - it can have a lot of features, but you have to install each as a plugin (many of which do come included uninstalled), so you started out with a very simple base.

Read full topic
